data: Provide education, patient information pamphlet and perscription on discharge
May be performed by RNs in the Emergency Departments and Urgent Care Centers
Refer to Decision Support Tool (DST): Asthma

Inclusion Criteria: 
1. Children greater than or equal to 1 year but less than 17 years AND
2. Presenting with wheezing OR respiratory distress AND
3. Previous diagnosis of asthma OR been treated 2
times prior with with bronchodilator for wheezing
4. Pediatric Respiratory Assessment Measure (PRAM) between 0 and 12, inclusive
PRAM greater than 7, notify treating provider / NP prior to administering medication

Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients less than 1 year of age
- Canadian Triage and Acuity Scale I (CTAS-resuscitation)
- Patients with any co-existing medical conditions
- Patients presenting with inspiratory stridor
- Patients in the ED under the care of subspecialists
- Known allergy to ipratropium, salbutamol and/or corticosteroids
Notify treating provider ED Management of an Acute Asthma NIP has been initiated
If use of steroids has occurred in the past 14 days
Baseline then q20min of initiating bronchiodilator
Baseline then q20min of initiating bronchiodilator
Baseline then q20min after each dose
5 puff, inhalation, q20min, order duration: 2 doses/times, drug form: inhaler, first dose: NOW
10 puff, inhalation, q20min, order duration: 2 doses/times, drug form: inhaler, first dose: NOW
q20min for the first hour, then q30 min to 60 min thereafter
If PRAM Remains 0 - 3, reassess PRAM Score I hour after last inhaled shorting acting bronchodilators or (Beta2-agonists bronchodilators) or salbutamol
Notify treating provider with moderate and severe symptoms
5 puff, inhalation, q20min, order duration: 3 doses/times, drug form: inhaler, first dose: NOW
10 puff, inhalation, q20min, order duration: 3 doses/times, drug form: inhaler, first dose: NOW
3 puff, inhalation, q20min, order duration: 3 doses/times, drug form: inhaler, first dose: NOW
6 puff, inhalation, q20min, order duration: 3 doses/times, drug form: inhaler, first dose: NOW
0.6 mg/kg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
0.6 mg/kg, PO, once, drug form: oral liq, first dose: NOW
Give salbutamol every hour if PRAM Score remains 4 -7
5 puff, inhalation, q1h, drug form inhaler,
10 puff, inhalation, q1h, drug form: inhaler
Notify treating provider with moderate and severe symptoms
5 puff, inhalation, q20min, order duration: 3 doses/times, drug form: inhaler, first dose: NOW
10 puff, inhalation, q20min, order duration: 3 doses/times, drug form: inhaler, first dose: NOW
3 puff, inhalation, q20min,  order duration: 3 doses/times, drug form: inhaler, first dose: NOW
6 puff, inhalation, q20min, order duration: 3 doses/times, drug form: inhaler, first dose: NOW
Notify Treating Provider prior to oral dexamethasone
0.6 mg/kg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
0.6 mg/kg, PO, once, drug form: oral liq, first dose: NOW
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 92% or greater, with a target saturation of 94-98% if possible
